title: 9 games in, an ‘embarrassed’ Bruins team is already seeing their season splinter
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "The reality — I think we saw last year — is what happens when you don't perform.
And that's the way things seem to be going.
” The Bruins have lost six games in a row.

title: Ask the gardener: Why to ‘Leave the Leaves’ in your yard this fall
author: Ulrich Lorimer
bullets: Gardening A campaign by the National Wildlife Federation and the Xerces Society, asserts that leaves are not trash, debris, or yard waste.
Fallen leaves MATTHIEU DELATY/Hans Lucas/AFP via Getty Images ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Autumn in New England is a cherished time marked by well-honored traditions, including apple picking, pumpkins, hayrides, and leaf peeping.

title: Gilded age mansion in Newport listed for $28 million
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Real Estate News A Gilded Age mansion, Seaview Terrace is one of the largest private homes in America.
Seaview Terrace at sunset.
Michael David Commercial One of America’s largest private homes is for sale in Newport, Rhode Island — and it comes with ocean views, Gilded Age glamour, and a few ghost stories.

title: The ‘Dawson’s Creek’ house is on the market — and it’s not actually on Cape Cod
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Real Estate Cue millennial nostalgia.
The real creek is actually called Hewlett’s Creek, and it's nowhere near Massachusetts.
A screened porch spans the width of the home.

title: Body found during search for missing Middlebury College student, police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News The body was found during police’s search for Lia Smith, 21, a college senior who was reported missing on Sunday.
Police in Vermont discovered a body while searching for a missing Middlebury College student on the school’s campus Thursday afternoon, they announced.
The Vermont State Police Search and Rescue Team found the body Thursday around 1:30 p.

title: Mass. ACA exchange begins to estimate skyrocketing premiums ahead of 2026
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Democratic lawmakers are pushing to pass extensions of tax credits, which make health care cheaper for millions of Americans and expire at the end of the year.
Massachusetts Health Connector Executive Director Audrey Morse Gasteier poses for a portrait in the state health insurance marketplace's office Tuesday, July 2, 2025, in Boston.
AP Photo /Leah Willingham ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Boston man facing animal cruelty charges for whipping, dragging dog, claims he was pet-sitting
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The man told law enforcement that he was pet-sitting the dog and was trying to train it, and further alleged that the dog bit him.
A Boston man is facing animal cruelty charges after he allegedly mistreated a dog he claimed to be pet-sitting, prosecutors said.

Akeem Pierre, 42, was charged Thursday in the Dorchester division of Boston Municipal Court with animal cruelty and animal cruelty by custodian, according to the Suffolk County District Attorney’s Office.

title: What have Patriots coaches told Drake Maye about sliding, avoiding injuries?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “He’s a competitive guy.
I think certainly making sure he’s available to the team is a priority.
" Drake Maye avoided an injury during Sunday's win over the Titans.
